## Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

We use EDA to "examin[e] and describ[e] data to gain insight, discover structure, and detect anomalies and outliers."

<p style="text-align:center"><img src="images/john_tukey.jpg" height = 250></p>

John Tukey (1915--2000), author of _Exploratory Data Analysis_ (1977) referred to EDA as numerical, counting, and graphical detective work. He is credited with introducing the terms 'bit' and 'software' while working on early computers at Bell Labs.
